pageTitle: UPDATE – Prime Minister’s itinerary for Friday, November 18, 2022 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Bangkok, Thailand

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the official welcome by the Prime Minister of Thailand, Prayut Chan-o-cha.

Note for media:

  • Official media and host broadcaster coverage

9:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Leaders’ Retreat I on balanced, inclusive and sustainable growth.

Note for media:

  • Official media and host broadcaster coverage

11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Prime Minister of New Zealand, Jacinda Ardern.

Closed to media

11:20 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Vice President of the United States of America, Kamala Harris.

Closed to media

11:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the APEC Leaders’ informal dialogue with guests.

Note for media:

  • Official media and host broadcaster coverage

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the APEC Leaders and Guests’ working luncheon.

Closed to media

2:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the APEC Leaders’ dialogue with the APEC Business Advisory Council (ABAC).

Note for media:

  • Official media and host broadcaster coverage

4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

5:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will have an audience with Their Majesties the King and Queen of Thailand.

Closed to media

10:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Djerba, Tunisia.

Don Mueang International Airport

Closed to media
